name: 林子喬
objective: Discuss the theories of computer relaying for power systems, including: 1. Introduction to computer relaying system; 2. Digital Signal Processing for computer relaying; 3. Numerical Analysis for computer relaying; 4. Discrete Fourier Transform Techniques; 5. Discrete Wavelet Transform-based technique; 6. Recursive Least squares (RLS) and Kalman filter-based techniques; 7.Differential equation-based techniques; 8. Transmission lines relaying; 9. Phasor calculation techniques; 10.Multi-terminal transmission line protection; 11.Principles of adaptive relay; 12.Relaying and Control
schedule:
Wk1: Course Introduction and Rules.
Wk2~Wk5: Basic and Advanced Mathematics for Computer Relaying.
Wk6~Wk7: Digital Signal Processing and Numerical Analysis. 
Wk8: Differential Equation-Based Techniques.
Wk9: Midterm Close Book Exam.
Wk10~Wk11: Discrete Fourier Transform and Phasor Calculation Techniques.
Wk12~Wk13:Transmission Lines Relaying.
Wk14~Wk15:System Relaying and Control.
Wk16~Wk17: Developments in New Realying Principles
Wk18: Final Close Book Exam.
scorePolicy: (一). Participation, Report, Quiz, and Homework (出席，報告，小考，與作業): 45%; (二). Midterm Exam (期中考): 25%; (三). Final Exam (期末考): 30%.
materials:
Textbook:
-Arun G. Phadke and James S. Thorp. Computer Relaying for Power Systems. John Wiley & Sons, 2009. 

Reference book:
-Arun G. Phadke, Stanley H. Horowitz, and Charles F. Henville. Power System Relaying, 5th Edition. John Wiley & Sons, 2022.
